justification: The paper uses the Aha! experience to measure insight, as supported by empirical findings that participants who reported an Aha! moment were more likely to provide correct responses to problems.
Anagram solving was used as a task to induce insights or Aha! moments; the success rate in solving anagrams was evaluated as a measure of insight occurrence and quality.
The experiment used a 12-point scale for participants to rate the truthiness of propositions. Higher ratings indicated greater perceived accuracy, correlating with the presence of an Aha! moment.
